Description: Tent hanging; rectangular, four panels hand sewn together along length. Plain weave; base cloth has natural-coloured cotton warp and weft with narrow blue-dyed warp stripes. Decorated on front in appliqué in brown, sand, red, green, light and dark blue, and natural-coloured cotton cloth hand sewn to base. Top of hanging has inscription in Arabic with further inscriptions in four panels below surrounded by foliate patterns. Central circular design has foliate motifs around outside. Flanked on both sides and bottom by repeating floral motifs. Hand hemmed at top and bottom edges. Bottom edge has seven small cotton tape loops sewn onto base cloth for suspension.
Condition: Fair; some light damage to red- and green-dyed applique cloth. Slightly grubby throughout.
Acquisition notes: Acquisition details unknown. Stored with African 'duplicate' material.
